title: WP_REST_API_Attachment
description: A media attachment object in a REST API context.

date.description: The date the attachment was published, in the site's timezone.

date_gmt.description: The date the attachment was published, as GMT.

guid.description: The globally unique identifier for the attachment.

raw.description: GUID for the attachment, as it exists in the database. Only present when using the 'edit' context.

rendered.description: GUID for the attachment, transformed for display.

featured_media.description: The ID of the featured media for the post.

modified.description: The date the attachment was last modified, in the site's timezone.

modified_gmt.description: The date the attachment was last modified, as GMT.

slug.description: An alphanumeric identifier for the attachment unique to its type.

status.description: A named status for the attachment.

type.description: Type of Post for the attachment.

alt_text.description: Alternative text to display when attachment is not displayed.

raw.description: Caption for the attachment, as it exists in the database. Only present when using the 'edit' context.

rendered.description: HTML caption for the attachment, transformed for display.

raw.description: Description for the attachment, as it exists in the database. Only present when using the 'edit' context.

rendered.description: HTML description for the attachment, transformed for display.

media_details.description: Details about the media file, specific to its type.

post.description: The ID for the associated post of the attachment.

source_url.description: URL to the original attachment file.

missing_image_sizes.description: List of the missing image sizes of the attachment.  Only present when using the 'edit' context.

permalink_template.description: Permalink template for the attachment. Only present when using the 'edit' context and the post type is public.

generated_slug.description: Slug automatically generated from the attachment title. Only present when using the 'edit' context and the post type is public.

raw.description: Title for the attachment, as it exists in the database. Only present when using the 'edit' context.

rendered.description: HTML title for the attachment, transformed for display.

author.description: The ID for the author of the attachment.

comment_status.description: Whether or not comments are open on the attachment.

ping_status.description: Whether or not the attachment can be pinged.

template.description: The theme file to use to display the attachment.

_embedded.description: The embedded representation of relations. Only present when the '_embed' query parameter is set.
